places.name: Victoria Memorial
places.description: A magnificent white marble building dedicated to Queen Victoria, now serving as a museum housing a vast collection of British-era artifacts.
places.bestTime: Morning (9 AM - 11 AM) or Evening (4 PM - 6 PM)

places.name: Howrah Bridge
places.description: An iconic cantilever bridge over the Hooghly River, one of the busiest bridges in the world carrying over 100,000 vehicles daily.
places.bestTime: Early morning for photos or evening for sunset views

places.name: Indian Museum
places.description: The largest and oldest museum in India, featuring rare antiques, armor, ornaments, fossils, and Mughal paintings.

places.name: Kalighat Kali Temple
places.description: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, this ancient Hindu temple is dedicated to Goddess Kali and attracts millions of devotees.

places.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
places.description: A famous Hindu temple dedicated to Bhavatarini, closely associated with Ramakrishna Paramahansa who served as its priest.

places.name: New Market (Hogg Market)
places.description: Kolkata's most famous shopping destination since 1874, offering everything from clothes to electronics to street food.

places.name: Park Street
places.description: Known as the 'food street of Kolkata', famous for its restaurants, pubs, and colonial-era buildings.

places.name: Eco Tourism Park
places.description: India's largest urban park spanning 480 acres with eco-cottages, musical fountain, and replicas of Seven Wonders.

places.name: Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Botanical Garden
places.description: Home to the famous Great Banyan Tree, one of the widest trees in the world, spread over 250 years old.

places.name: Science City
places.description: The largest science museum in the Indian subcontinent with interactive exhibits, space theater, and evolution park.

places.name: Marble Palace
places.description: A 19th-century palatial mansion known for its marble architecture and collection of paintings by Rubens and Reynolds.

places.name: College Street Book Market
places.description: The largest secondhand book market in the world, home to Coffee House and Presidency University.
